title.fieldDescription: Provide a meta title to display in browser tabs and search engine results. Maximum of 70 characters. Include a brand keyword if applicable. Must be unique to each page. Include site name after a pipe delimiter at the end of the title, e.g. "Page Title | Corteva Agriscience"
title.name: ./jcr:title

pagetitle.fieldDescription: Provide a friendly page title that displays in internal search results, dynamic cards, and tiles. Can be the same as product name. Maximum of 50 characters.
pagetitle.name: ./pageTitle

pagename.fieldDescription: The text entered here is displayed as part of the URL for this page. Leave this field blank to keep the auto-generated URL. Or, enter a custom page name to be included in the URL. The URLs cannot have spaces or special characters. It is recommended to use lowercase characters and dashes instead of spaces, e.g. enter-url-in-this-format
pagename.name: pageName

navigationtitle.fieldDescription: If desired, specify a shortened page title to display in breadcrumbs. If left empty, the Page Title will be displayed in breadcrumbs instead. Maximum of 50 characters.
navigationtitle.name: ./navTitle

contentType.fieldDescription: Select the most applicable content type for this page, to categorize this content for On-Site Search filtering and other purposes. (Required)
contentType.name: ./contentType

tags.fieldDescription: Select all taxonomy tags that best describe this page. Tag at the most specific level possible; tags automatically inherit their parents. Tags selected here are used in a variety of places like Article Feeds or Product Finders to enable filtering and display of data.
tags.name: ./cq:tags

tagsShowOnCreate.granite:comment: Handled by a custom POST servlet for the Create Page case
tagsShowOnCreate.name: ./cq:tags

description.fieldDescription: Provide a brief description of the page to be displayed in various places, like search results, social media sharing and feeds. Maximum of 160 characters. Must be unique to each page.
description.name: ./jcr:description

keywords.fieldDescription: If desired, provide up to 8 target keywords that describe the page content, which will be rendered as meta tags on the page. This will not impact search engine ranking.
keywords.name: ./keywords

alternateHREF.fieldDescription: Optional, for sites with multiple languages: Configure a reference to the equivalent page in all other languages. This renders HREF LANG meta tags on the page for improved search engine optimization and user experience.

canonicalUrl.fieldDescription: Optional, for situations where this page is a similar or identical copy of another page, created for various purposes: Configure a reference to the master version of this page. Doing so will set a canonical URL meta tag to tell search engines which alterate version of this page should receive the page ranking value generated by this page. If left blank (default), a self-referencing canonical URL meta tag will be set, which means this page retains its own page ranking value.
canonicalUrl.name: ./canonicalUrl

sitemap-index.fieldDescription: Use this toggle to set search engine indexing instructions (robots tags) for this page. When set to Yes (default), search engines (both external like Google, and internal like on-site search) will be instructed to index the page and crawl links from this page (index, follow). When set to No, search engines will be instructed not to index the page or follow any links on the page (noindex, nofollow). Set to Yes unless there is a specific reason to suppress this page from being crawled by search engines (including both on-site search and external engines like Google).
sitemap-index.fieldLabel: Allow search engines to index and crawl this page
sitemap-index.name: ./sitemapIndex

hideinnav.fieldDescription: Use this toggle to hide a page from the XML and HTML sitemaps, and suppress it from appearing in breadcrumbs where applicable. If unchecked (default), the page will be included in sitemaps and breadcrumbs. If checked, this page will be hidden from XML and HTML sitemaps, and breadcrumbs. Sitemaps aid search engines in crawling the site. Leave unchecked unless there is a specific reason to suppress this page from appearing in the sitemaps.
hideinnav.name: ./hideInNav
hideinnav.text: Hide this page from Sitemap and Breadcrumb

hideinhtmlsitemap.fieldDescription: Use this toggle to hide a page from the HTML sitemap. If unchecked (default), the page will be included in HTML sitemap. If checked, this page will be hidden from HTML sitemap. Leave unchecked unless there is a specific reason to suppress this page from appearing in the HTML sitemap.
hideinhtmlsitemap.name: ./hideInHtmlSitemap
hideinhtmlsitemap.text: Hide this page from HTML Sitemap

changefeq.fieldDescription: Select a choice from the dropdown to inform search engines (via the XML sitemap) how often the content on this page is likely to change. (Default is monthly).
changefeq.name: ./changeFeq

priorty.fieldDescription: Select a choice from the dropdown to inform search engines about the relative priority of this page, compared to all other pages on the same site. This value will be included in the XML sitemap. Higher numbers mean higher priority; lower means lower priority. Default is 0.5, which means equal priority. Do not change this value unless specifically instructed.
priorty.name: ./priorty

contentauthor.fieldDescription: AEM user that last modified this page. For informational purposes only.
contentauthor.name: ./cq:lastModifiedBy

replicationaction.fieldDescription: Current publish status of this page (Activated or Deactivated). For informational purposes only.
replicationaction.name: ./cq:lastReplicationAction

publish.fieldDescription: Date this page was last activated, updated or deactivated on the live site (replication date). For informational purposes only.
publish.name: ./cq:lastReplicated

modified.fieldDescription: Date this page was last modified. For informational purposes only.
modified.name: ./cq:lastModified

ondate.fieldDescription: Use this field to schedule a date and time to activate a published page. When published, this page will be kept dormant until the specified date and time. When left blank (default), the pages will be published immediately.
ondate.name: ./onTime

offdate.fieldDescription: Use this field to indicate the time at which the published page will be deactivated. When left blank (default), the pages will be published immediately.
offdate.name: ./offTime

expirationDate.fieldDescription: For Content Expiration Dashboard purposes only. Select a date for this page which will be displayed in the Content Expiration Dashboard as a reminder to update any content or to extend the expiration date of a given page. Selecting a date for this field will not expire or archive a page.
expirationDate.name: ./expirationDate

error-pages.fieldDescription: Use this field to select alternate error pages for this page. When left blank (default), the page will inherit the error pages configured on a parent page. Select a different error page path here when this page should use different error pages. If unsure, do not modify this field!
error-pages.name: ./errorPages

expfrag-header.fieldDescription: Use this field to select an alternate header (including navigation) for this page. When left blank (default), the page will inherit the header configured on a parent page. Select a different header experience fragment here when this page should use a different header (e.g. landing pages, microsites, etc.) If unsure, do not modify this field!
expfrag-header.name: ./expfragHeader

expfrag-footer.fieldDescription: Use this field to select an alternate footer for this page. When left blank (default), the page will inherit the footer configured on a parent page. Select a different footer experience fragment here when this page should use a different footer (e.g. landing pages, microsites, etc.) If unsure, do not modify this field!
expfrag-footer.name: ./expfragFooter

allowedtemplates.fieldDescription: Click 'Add Field' to add a template or a list of templates to be allowed as child pages. Each value in the list must be an absolute path to a template or use '/.*' to allow all templates below this path.

cugconfigwarning.warning:
The Authentication Requirement cannot be edited because the page is using a deprecated configuration for the Closed User Group.
Please refer to the documentation.

enable.fieldDescription: You might need to configure a Closed User Group in the Permission tab.
